pinned window. If so, then disable the more button. This ensures that

quick settings cannot be accessed during a locked quiz. See

crrev.com/c/4156536 which is the same change but for the

audio slider.

entry.title: Flags UI: Remove jstemplate.
entry.content:
jstemplate is deprecated and no longer used. This CL removes

its usage in chrome://flags, which also makes the page less

wasteful while rendering content.



The template rendering strategy attached all available experiments into

the DOM twice, one in a section for non-default experiments and one in a

section for default experiments. It then toggled the visibility of each

element depending on whether it was default or non-default.



This approach instead only attaches each experiment to its respective

section depending on its status as default. Therefore, no extra elements

need to be attached and toggled to 'hidden'.



This CL brings the time it takes to render experiments down from

1.5s to 1.25s on Linux.



Bug: 1376313, 525224

Change-Id: I57ffcb1880ee920e91ae37915013869877babfca

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4629592

Commit-Queue: Cole Horvitz

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1161539}

entry.title: [video_capture] Use Close instead of Suspend
entry.content:
The intent of adding the suspend method was to stop the video stream,

but suspend only pauses it. This results in the device only being

deallocated several seconds later after a timeout.



Changing to use Close instead of Suspend more closely matches the

intent of this function and results in immediate device deallocation

if there are no remaining subscribers.

entry.title: render_context_menu: Make use of ash::TryOpenUrl
entry.content:
Now that ash::TryOpenUrl is easily reusable, use it for the context

menu actions that open a URL (e.g. "Open link in new window").



When Lacros is enabled, the previous behavior of these actions in Ash (think: SWAs) was to always open the URL in Lacros. TryOpenUrl generally

also opens the URL in Lacros but it has a few special cases for things

like chrome:// URLs. These same special cases apply when opening the URL

by other means (e.g. shift-clicking, or even ordinary clicking for target=_blank links), so this change reduces surprises.



Bug: chromium:1444283

entry.title: Refactor AppendContentsToFrame to take an optional device_scale_factor
entry.content:
This change is a follow up to crrev.com/c/4630949 which only

applies scaling if device_scale_factor is passed to

AppendContentsToFrame and AppendSurfaceHierarchyContentsToFrame.



This allows us to remove the client_submits_in_pixel_coords

parameter from these two methods - scaling only needs to applied

if the client does not submit in target space (pixel) coordinates.



TEST=Connect an external monitor.

- Set different scale factors between the two monitors.

- Open Lacros, move it between the two monitors.

- Verify that rounded corners, shadows and UI elements

are properly sized, scaled and clipped.

- Also, open ARC apps and verify those are properly scaled too.

- ARC notifications are also scared correctly in both monitors.

- Create a Crostini VM, install a Wayland app and a X11 app.

- Verify that both Linux apps are scaled appropriately,

in both low and high density mode.



BUG=1450006

entry.title: App Service: Track media usage using MediaStreamCaptureIndicator
entry.content:
This replaces usage of MediaCaptureDevicesDispatcher in the Extensions

publisher with MediaStreamCaptureIndicator, which is simpler and avoids

a few edge-case bugs.



As this is the last usage of MediaCaptureDevicesDispatcher, we are able

to clean up some unused code for some tracking which is done by the

CaptureIndicator API automatically.

entry.title: Marshal primary_screen_id over Mojo in CRD VideoLayout messages
entry.content:
CRD uses the primary_screen_id in the client to determine which of the |screen_id|s sent from the host is the primary display. This works on other platforms but not on Windows because the primary_screen_id value is not being marshalled across the Mojo channel so it is never sent to the website client. This CL plumbs it through.

entry.title: Add --webtransport-developer-mode flag
entry.content:
Currently, in order to test WebTransport against a local server, the

developers have to pass a correct --origins-to-force-quic-on flag.

This is both counterintuitive, and overly broad (since it affects

non-WebTransport connections). The new setting is equivalent to

--origins-to-force-quic-on=*, but for WebTransport only.

entry.title: [Extensions] Don't decrement service worker keepalives after termination
entry.content:
Extension functions increment and decrement service keepalives via

external requests when they are initiated and completed. However, it's

possible the service worker is no longer around when the API function

completes, even if the extension is still enabled; for instance, this

can happen if the API function exceeds the maximum time and the

extension is not active in other ways.



When this happens, we should avoid trying to decrement the service

worker keepalive, since the worker itself has been shut down. Handle

this case, and add an end-to-end test.



Bug: 1453534

entry.title: Reland "Restored focus on up next view after refreshing up next events"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 6e4ac1041abbe81f7e1966bda369c434fe0881d8



ASAN catches a heap-use-after-free crash for the previous fix. It turns

out we cannot save the focused view and check if it's contained in the

content_view_ because a different address will be allocated if a new

CalendarEventListItemViewJelly is added into the content_view_. The root

cause of the original bug is: we checked if the displayed events are the

same with the newly fetched event list, but there's a typo in the method

so that even if the events are the same, we still remove them and add

new events into the up_next_view. This CL fixed the typo so that if the

event list isn't updated, the focus should be preserved on the first

item. If the event list gets updated, the focus should be lost, which is

intended. We can reuse the same unit test that's added in the original

change to test this fix.



Original change's description:

> Restored focus on up next view after refreshing up next events

>

> Before the fix: the focus on the CalendarEventListItemViewJelly will be

> lost after the up next view is refreshed every 15 seconds.

> This issue is fixed by saving the focused view before updating the

> events. Then if the focused view is a child view of the up next content

> view, restore the focus on it after the refresh.

>

> Bug: b:286596205

> Change-Id: I81c41b0346db2de068e5b0499187d6c428277c71

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4629589

> Reviewed-by: Jiaming Cheng

> Commit-Queue: Sylvie Liu

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1160812}

entry.title: Make base::StringPiece a typedef for std::string_view
entry.content:
Because of how pervasive base::StringPiece is in the codebase, this does

not replace callers just yet, or even change includes (quite a few files

have IWYU violations masked by string_piece.h). Instead, start by

getting the types to match, then we'll gradually rewrite references,

remove the include, and fix IWYU issues.



Hardening comparison and other notes about the changes needed:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1d4RnD1uAE2t4iANR0nXy82ASIPGsPuw2mpO6v6T7JKs/edit?usp=sharing



One thing to call out here is that std::u16string_view and

std::wstring_view, unlike base::WStringPiece and base::StringPiece16,

do *not* support operator<< on std::ostream. Previously, we would

automatically convert for you, but the STL expects the caller do an

explicit conversion. (You can only write strings whose character type

matches the ostream's character type.)



For this CL, I've opted to make utf_ostream_operators.h that

individual files can include if they need it. Long-term, I think we

should migrate to call sites converting explicitly with UTF16ToUTF8

and WideToUTF8, but we can decide separately whether to do that and

migrate. In the meantime, utf_ostream_operators.h is just analogous

to what was previously in base/logging.h, without forcing a

base/logging.h include.



Further discussion:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/Ix2BzMzf7WI



Bug: 691162

Change-Id: I3a0b190afd012a2eedd1b79346c337f6b8d4f941

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Do not focus Network page on initial app load
entry.content:
When the CrOS Settings app root page is loaded (chrome://os-settings/),

the Network page should not be focused. Instead, the search box should

be the initially focused element, allowing for faster navigation for

our keyboard users. This functionality regressed after

crrev.com/c/4614412 and is fixed in this CL.



Extracted the route navigation tests to a separate test file to mitigate

timeout errors. The test is in JS instead of TS since some of the test

fixtures used are not supported in TS yet, which is out-of-scope of this

CL.



Screen recording: http://shortn/_Ownbdg3Bsb



Bug: b/285968876

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="OSSettingsMainPageContainer*"

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="OSSettingsOsSettingsUi*"

entry.title: [reland] Enable *building* Rusty QR Code Generation on Android and Linux
entry.content:
This is a reland of the core part of https://crrev.com/c/4509543. The

reland has been made possible by the following fixes:

- https://crrev.com/c/4636942 (split out from the original CL)

- https://crrev.com/c/4633412

- https://crrev.com/c/4634895



This CL enables *building* of Rusty QR Code Generation on the same

platforms and configs where `enable_rust_crash` is built. It changes

both `enable_rust_qr` and `enable_rust_base_conversions`, because

QR-related FFI requires conversions from `base::span` into

`rust::Slice`.



This CL does *not* yet *use* Rusty QR Code Generation at runtime,

because the "RustyQrCodeGenerator" feature remains disabled by default.



Since this CL starts to include the `third_party/rust/qr_code` library,

it expectedly leads to a ~22kB binary size increase. This increase has

been reviewed and approved when the ATLs have reviewed landing of the

third-party library (see https://crrev.com/c/4497329 and the approvals

listed from that other CL's description). Also note that evaluating the

binary size impact of shipping Rust code is tricky, because the cost of

the base C++ libraries is amortized across multiple components, while

the cost of the base Rust libraries will initially only support the QR

crate.



Bug: 1431991

Binary-Size: Size increase is unavoidable (see above).

Change-Id: I380d904f5370d5ee129179abd0a0b949474b53cb

entry.title: Stop AppHomePageHandlerTest pinning to the taskbar
entry.content:
AppHomePageHandlerTest.Create* tests are pinning shortcuts to the

Windows taskbar, and leaking shortcuts on the Desktop. This CL fixes

that by using OsIntegrationTestOverrideImpl::BlockingRegistration and

SimulateDeleteShortcutsByUser.



It also adds a call to FlushShortcutTasks() after the dialog is

closed, because that creates shortcuts. This is needed because

SimulateDeleteShortcutsByUser dchecks if the expected shortcuts don't

exist.

entry.title: Make HaTS Service callable from the PingManager
entry.content:
The HaTS Service is defined in //chrome. The PingManager is defined in

//components. We want to call the HaTS service after the CSBRR has

been constructed to enable sending telemetry with survey responses.



This is the first of 3 CLs. A followup CL will extract telemetry from

CSBRRs input from FeatureParams to trigger HaTS surveys. The last CL

will update CSBRR logic so that SSB user telemetry will be sent

without having a CSBRR transmitted to Safe Browsing. The telemetry will

only be sent with their survey responses.



Overall design: go/crca-hats-for-red-warnings

entry.title: Reland "Invalidate the AX subtree when recomputing NGOffsetMapping."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4b2d3475305ad7a6ffe5fa5e357d3adaecc9de32.



Changes from previous version:

* Fixed invalidation of children when images lose their layout object.

* Fixed corner cases where elements assert due to having no ability

to have children.



Reason for revert: Fixed broken tests, including:



external/wpt/accessibility/crashtests/append-image-using-illegal-map.html



(This CL (*) regressed things a bit because it didn't walk children,

but even that was a bit wrong because the image's children could have been not up-to-date.)



fast/forms/input-value.html

fast/css/content-property-quote-types.html





(*) https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4605033



Bug: 1342801



Original change's description:

> Revert "Invalidate the AX subtree when recomputing NGOffsetMapping."

>

> This reverts commit b6a9046efd20a08c03430cacd5ad888289e53089.

>

> Reason for revert: Suspecting this is breaking several bots

>

> Some bots (mac specifically) fail mostly consistently, other linux

> bots fail but less consistently.

>

> First visible mac bot failures

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac10.14%20Tests/35034/overview

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac11-arm64-rel-tests/20360/overview

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac12%20Tests/10298/overview

>

> Linux bot failures

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-dbg/33189/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > Invalidate the AX subtree when recomputing NGOffsetMapping.

> >

> > NGOffsetMapping determines the start and end character of text runs

> > corresponding to nodes in the tree. The text can depend on all of the

> > nodes (text and non-text) contributing to a LayoutBlockFlow. Therefore

> > we need to invalidate all of the descendants of the LayoutBlockFlow

> > when that offset is recomputed; otherwise, we might end up with

> > the wrong TextAlternative for an AXObject.

> >

> > This is the root cause of two flaky tests for CL 4553316:

> >

> > * DumpAccessibilityTreeTest.AccessibilityCSSVisibility/blink

> > * DumpAccessibilityTreeTestWithIgnoredNodes.InertAttribute/blink

> >

> > The failures can be reproduced reliably when using this flag:

> >

> > --enable-blink-features=HTMLParserYieldAndDelayOftenForTesting

> >

> > Because it causes the HTML parser to yield sometimes after a text

> > node that has a trailing whitespace, followed by another node that

> > affects whether that whitespace is reflected in

> > LayoutText::PlainText.

> >

> > Change-Id: Ifb11d7227ea311a614889eb446abbb525ce51e3b

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4602526

> > Commit-Queue: Chris Harrelson

> > Reviewed-by: Aaron Leventhal

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1156958}

>

> Change-Id: Idefd4cdabe7fe80e56b4ff4a2a8a82e4585dd941

> No-Tree-Checks: true

entry.title: graphite: Fix WritePixels failures for tab capture
entry.content:
After NV12 tab capture was disabled for graphite in crrev.com/c/4617537,

I420 tab capture is used which amongst other side-effects triggers a

call to RasterDecoder::WritePixels which doesn't flush correctly for

Graphite. After fixing that issue Graphite then crashes on an assert due

to kUnknown_SkAlphaType being used. This CL addresses both these issues,

but that's not sufficient to get tab capture to work since Graphite

lacks I420 conversion support.

Rename the metric Platform.Hibernate.LoginToResumeReady to

Platform.Hibernate.ResumeTime.Total. The idea is to have a

namespace for resume time metrics. Also update the description

to reflect that this is time between the user logging in and

the hibernated system being restored.



As of now the LoginToResumeReady metric is not used by devices

in the field, so it can be simply renamed instead of keeping

the old name around for some time.

entry.title: Record interval between two consecutive back press events.
entry.content:
This CL adds histogram to record the interval between two back press

events. Recent assertions and bugs show users tend to press the

back button multiple times in a very short period of time. This can

trigger some edge cases, in particular when the back press will enable

an animation, e.g. the tab switcher animation is triggered by

back press event and the back press event during animation can

cause unexpected behavior. Adding this histogram can help evaluate

and assess the impact and whether we should handle the back press

occurring during the animation.



Currently, this records at most 3 seconds with at most 50 buckets.



This CL also updates some assertion messages.



Bug: 1440211

Change-Id: I9945331bfb1db39240ae934b2b068709be7243d8

entry.title: Move MojoAudioDecoder to its own thread.
entry.content:
Run MojoAudioDecoder on a high priority thread to avoid audio underrun

in renderer. In addition, this also helps video decoder because it moves

some busy task off the video decoder's thread.



2. Cast encrypted stream and log shows fewer audio/video decoder

underflow.

utils.



The remaining problems are necessary for some code that needs to

include from files in tflite_kernel_internals. This entailed

moving tflite_kernel_internals to public_deps and then fixing the

following:



In file included from ../../third_party/tflite/src/tensorflow/lite/kernels/internal/reference/dequantize.h:22:

entry.title: cc: Forces regenerate tiles when the size of the tiles changes
entry.content:
If the pending tree is modified twice in the same frame and the tile

size changes during the second modification, UpdateTilePriorities will

return too early, causing the pending tree to be unable to generate

tiles again, resulting in checkerboard.



This commit fixes the issue.



Bug: 1454419

entry.title: Simplify DWM transitions on Windows
entry.content:
This CL removes unnecessary steps when changing themes and performing a

DWM transition on Windows.



On Windows 10 and above, we never transition between the native DWM

frame and the custom frame since DWM composition is always on, and all

themes use the native frame. This removes the need to hide and show the

window when changing themes, which also fixes related keyboard focus

issues.



This also removes the obsolete debug-enable-frame-toggle switch and

skips unit test calls to Widget::DebugToggleFrameType() on Windows

since they're no longer needed.



Bug: 1446712, 1246181, 1381254

Change-Id: I5e7ff2ab8d347066236cd061ada0e77e77fd7d8e

entry.title: graphite: Stop using bottom left origin for webgpu mailbox texture
entry.content:
Graphite won't support bottom left origin SkSurfaces for rendering.

WebGPUMailboxTexture is used to create an intermediate copy of a canvas

resource and uses the same origin as the source image which can be

bottom left. Even though the mailbox texture is consumed in WebGPU, the

copy from the source image uses Skia.



This CL makes WebGPU CanvasResourceProvider always use top left origin.

The `is_origin_top_left` parameter has been removed throughout, and as

a result ResourceCacheKey is also gone since we only need SkImageInfo

now (it was never really used as a map key anyway).



Bug: 1456636

Change-Id: Ic17d8c6fca58b859dee6204e74ed0dfc593707c6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4634777

entry.title: Re-enable Flake Endorser on CQ ChromeOS
entry.content:
This change re-enables Flake Endorser for ChromeOS. This is part 3 of 3.



Flake Endorser was previously disabled on these builders due to a high

false positive rate, impacting users as it was repeating tests that

were unrelated to their patchset.



ResultDB Test Results optionally allow tests to upload a file path

as part of its metadata, associating a specific test to a file.

Most of Chrome have this being set.



In crrev/c/4628558, Flake Endorser utilizes that by checking that new

tests with a file path defined have that file path being modified

as part of the patchset. If not, it's skipped. If file path is not

defined, it's included, but re-verified through the TestHistory RPC call.



Bug: 1414157, 1434778

Change-Id: I2fc88f5079cca96684aba1071bf4144dda13b140

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4633632

entry.title: [WebAuthn] Separate Android AuthenticatorImpl cleanup from close()
entry.content:
Currently `close()` is called in AuthenticatorImpl.java when a

WebAuthn request completes. `close()` is overriden from the mojo

Interface class, and is also called when the connection terminates.



This change adds `cleanupRequest()` which performs the request state

cleanup, so that `close()` can be used as a clear signal that the

connection has closed.



Bug: 1457277

entry.title: Improve event listener dispatch
entry.content:
This change makes event dispatching match the HTML spec.

1) Removed attribute is added to the RegisteredEventListener

2) A clone of the EventListeners is made during dispatch and

the FiringEventListeners object that was allocated is removed.

3) RegisteredEventListener is now a GC'd object so it is safe

to copy.



This code greatly simplifies the behavior and is easier to

understand.

entry.title: Disabled CountryNamesForLocaleTest.EmptyCountryCodeForEmptyLocale
entry.content:
Due to changes in iOS17, locale display names returned by the function

l10n_util::GetDisplayNameForCountry are countries full names

(i.e Canada). As a result, the `localized_names` hashMap contains these

full country names as keys. Thus, the testcase fails because the

assertion that the key "United States" is not in the hash map is no

longer true.

entry.title: Deflake external/wpt/accessibility/crashtests/delayed-ignored-change.html
entry.content:
The test uses document "load" event to delay removing the "test-wait"

class until after rendering. But "load" isn't fired at document --

this event bubbles from stylesheet load, which fires in a separate task.

This task can run before the test registers the event listener if the

parser yields before executing the

entry.title: [wptrunner] Fix `--isolated-script-test-filter`
entry.content:
* Force `wpt run --default-exclude` so that it's possible to run zero

tests. As shown by [0], [1] was regressed.

* Use `fnmatch` instead of `glob` to resolve the glob pattern

symbolically. `glob` gets its information from the filesystem, which

is incorrect when the test ID is not a file (`.any.js` and variants).



[0]: https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=62d513b78eb1fd10

[1]: crrev.com/c/4410043

entry.title: Flags UI: Continue migration to web components.
entry.content:
This CL makes several improvements to chrome://flags:

- Replaces references to flags-experiment's shadowDom from flags.ts

with explicit API calls on FlagsExperimentElement.

- Moves style modifications on flags-experiment from inside flags.ts

to inside FlagsExperimentElement.

- Refactors and simplifies FlagSearch, moving much of the filtering

and highlighting logic into FlagsExperimentElement.

- Refactors and simplifies the logic in the onchange listeners of

selects and textareas. Moves much of the logic into

FlagsExperimentElement.

- Implement FlagsBrowserProxy to add a proxy layer between flags UI and

API calls to the backend.

entry.title: [FedCM] Record account response invalid reasons
entry.content:
This patch introduces more granularity for "invalid account response" to

help us to better understand what causes the response to be invalid.



This is important because it's tied to how we update the IdpSigninStatus

therefore could affect the accuracy of the browser's knowledge of user's

sign-in status.

entry.title: [Color correction] Rename pref from *Filtering to *Correction
entry.content:
This purely mechanical change renames the preferences used for color

correction settings to be consistently "color correction" rather than

"color filtering", which will make it easier to match them against the

related enterprise policy, ColorCorrectionEnabled.



It also renames the preference for color correction filter to make

it more clear it's related to the filter type.



This does not change the underlying pref strings and has no impact

for users who have enabled the feature.



Also renames a few color filtering -> correction method names.

entry.title: [iOS] Update the display of sync errors in account settings.
entry.content:
For signed in not syncing accounts, the sync errors will be shown as a

text button instead of an icon. And it will be preceded by a description

message.



The types of errors and ways of handling them should not change.



This CL updates the following for signed in not syncing only:

* Adds the message item type.

* Displays the sync error as TableViewTextItem instead of

TableViewDetailIconItem.

* Sets the location of the error section below the large avatar item.



Screenshot in https://crbug.com/1447017#c20

entry.title: AbortSignal: Don't call SignalAbort directly in navigation_api
entry.content:
Instead, create an AbortController per NavigateEvent and initialize the

event's signal to the controller's signal, using the controller to abort

the signal.



See also https://github.com/whatwg/dom/issues/1194 and

https://github.com/WICG/navigation-api/issues/265.
